title: 40+ Distinct Buckhead Neighborhoods in Atlanta - Buckhead
text: Arden – Habersham A coveted “old Buckhead” neighborhood around the corner from the Gonvernor’s Mansion, Arden – Habersham is a peaceful residential neighborhood. Home / Buckhead Neighborhoods More than 40 distinct neighborhoods make up the small slice of Atlanta known as Buckhead, which entices residents of all ages and stages of life to enjoy this premier community’s intown luxury lifestyle. Each neighborhood in Buckhead has its own style and features that appeal to different people. Our extensive guide through the neighborhoods below will help you identify the right one for you. A coveted “old Buckhead” neighborhood around the corner from the Gonvernor’s Mansion, Arden – Habersham is a peaceful residential neighborhood. A Prominent Buckhead neighborhood with large lots, beautiful homes, desirable location, top-rated public/private schools and more! The Brandon neighborhood is a prime example of Buckhead’s classic lifestyle of both big-city conveniences and private suburban atmosphere. In a top-ranked school district, the neighborhood serves as a hub of activity, with privacy for residents living off the main streets. Historic Brookhaven has been a popular Buckhead area for over 100 years. Developed in 1910, it has evolved today into a bucolic destination. Conveniently close to Phipps Plaza and Lenox Square malls, restaurants, and the other amenities of the Buckhead Village District. Brookwood Hills is a charming and picturesque neighborhood on the National Register of Historic Places. The curving, tree-lined streets showcase a variety of enchanting homes, at the meeting point of Buckhead and Midtown. Often referred to as the “Buckhead Triangle,” Buckhead forest is one of Buckhead’s best neighborhoods for true city living. From the St. Regis Hotel and Residences to the exclusive new shopping district, Buckhead Village is experiencing exponential growth. It is the place to be with exceptional restaurants and shopping, catering to the most affluent clientele in the city. Castlewood is a lush wooded neighborhood fit to accommodate the whole family, characterized by tranquil tree-lined streets and graceful homes in a great location. You might think that life for folks who live near the 268-acre Chastain Park is all about jogging, tennis, little league and driving around in golf carts. You’d be right! Collier Hills is a quiet neighborhood with natural surroundings steps from Tanyard Creek park and the Atlanta Beltline. Cross Creek is Buckhead’s peaceful gated 1960’s condo community situated in the heart of natural surroundings, with acres of mature trees and Peachtree Creek. Fernleaf Park is truly a hidden gem on Buckhead’s west side, with easy access to Midtown and Downtown Atlanta. This quaint historic Buckhead neighborhood was founded in 1925 as a country club community. A tightly-knit community with urban perks, residents of the Garden Hills neighborhood will be the first to tell you just how wonderful it is! A family-centric Buckhead neighborhood originally developed in the 1960s, known for its active neighborhood association. Overflowing with character and old school charm, Haynes Manor streets are lined with some of the most beautiful homes in all of Buckhead. Kingswood is a central, upscale neighborhood in Buckhead. Most streets conclude in a cul-de-sac, resulting in a community-minded and quiet neighborhood. Margaret Mitchell’s mostly-quiet streets are busy with walkers and joggers, while kids congregate in front yards for afternoon games. Peaceful windy streets guide you through Atlanta Memorial Park showcasing Buckhead’s natural beauty and humble charm. Mt. Paran – Northside is a Buckhead neighborhood on the scenic road from Roswell Rd to Northside Pkwy with some of the priciest in the 30327 zip code. The North Buckhead neighborhood enjoys lush, forested surroundings and peaceful streets complemented by nearby bustling shopping and restaurant destinations. Paces embodies what Buckhead is really about. A wonderful quality of life combined with the conveniences of a modern city at your doorstep…or your front gate. Since it’s development began in the early 1900’s, Peachtree Heights East has maintained a perfectly charming atmosphere that harkens back to it’s founding days. The homes in Peachtree Heights West are a treasure trove of historic architecture and Southern charm. These approximately 400 homes are some of Buckhead’s finest, and nearly every home is worthy of a magazine cover. Peachtree Hills is the neighborhood of choice for many young buyers looking for a prime location in Buckhead, a cool vibe, and sub-$750k prices. Peachtree Park is a historic pocket of quietude that is literally surrounded by the heart of Buckhead’s bustling commercial center. Pine Hills is a well-established, mostly residential neighborhood located on the eastern side of the Buckhead community in northeast Atlanta The Randall Mill lifestyle is luxurious, stately homes, hidden away near the bustling city. Since the neighborhood’s inception in the 1920s, the Buckhead community of Ridgedale Park has been a charming enclave of Tudor Revival and cottage style homes. Sandy Spring ITP | This Buckhead neighborhood boasts a surprisingly rural feel – showcasing serene estates situated on up to 25+ acres. South Tuxedo Park is a small neighborhood that combines just about everything you might move to Buckhead for. Tuxedo Park is the undisputed top-shelf neighborhood in Buckhead. With 100 years of the finest architecture, the estates are deserving of their reputation. Vinings is known for its charming walkable village atmosphere, with beautiful homes set amongst natural scenery. Wesley Battle is a tiny pocket of lovely homes on the west side of Buckhead. Despite the somewhat remote feel of the neighborhood, the sidewalks along Peachtree Battle connect walkers and joggers all the way to Peachtree Rd with beautiful scenery along the way. The West Paces Ferry – Northside neighborhood includes very desirable streets where a strong sense of community abounds. Westover Plantation is Buckhead’s active gated community of 280 elegant English traditional townhomes situated on the SW edge of Buckhead, minutes from Midtown and Downtown Atlanta. An escape amid Atlanta’s bustling Buckhead community with winding trails and river activities, large lots, and long driveways with most homes perched behind wooded landscapes. Wildwood enjoys a natural setting and close-knit community, just a call away from meeting friends at Beaverbrook Park.
